channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: The US is in a 'free fall' with Covid-19, doctors warn
Herd immunity to Covid-19 may be 'unachievable', large-scale study indicates
item.description: Spain's large-scale study on the coronavirus indicates just 5% of its population has developed antibodies, strengthening evidence that a so-called herd immunity to Covid-19 is "unachievable," the medical journal the Lancet reported on Monday.

item.title: Major Texas city may run out of hospital beds in a week
Australia to seal off 6.6 million people in virus-hit state as outbreak worsens
This country saw a 600% jump in virus cases
item.description: Iraq's largest cemetery receives 70-80 bodies a day, but those numbers are expected to get much worse in a country whose infrastructure has been wrought by decades of sanctions, war, and corruption. CNN's Arwa Damon reports.

item.title: Agencies seem to be afraid to talk about virus being airborne, expert says
item.description: Imagine a noisy, crowded bar. Music is pounding, and people are clustered close together, talking loudly or even shouting to be heard. If it's cold out, doors and windows are shut tight and the heat is on, or if it's hot out, everything is shut and the air conditioner is recirculating the air.

item.title: Covid-19 antibody cocktail that might treat and prevent infection enters Phase 3 trial
item.description: An antibody cocktail is now beginning late-stage clinical trials to evaluate the drug's ability to prevent and treat coronavirus infection.

item.title: Tensions heat up in South China Sea as US makes significant show of force
item.description: For the first time in six years, two US Navy aircraft carriers are in the South China Sea, the latest show of military might from Washington as it pushes back against China's sweeping claim to much of the contested region.

item.title: CNN's Dana Bash presses senator: You criticized Obama for this
item.description: CNN's Dana Bash questions Sen. Joni Ernst (R-IA) over her criticism of former President Obama over his handling of the Ebola outbreak in 2014, compared to President Trump's current handling of the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: The bubonic plague is back again in China's Inner Mongolia
item.description: Authorities in the Chinese region of Inner Mongolia are on high alert after a suspected case of bubonic plague, the disease that caused the Black Death pandemic, was reported Sunday.

item.title: Explosive Trump tell-all book by his niece coming out two weeks early
item.description: A tell-all book by President Trump's niece Mary, a licensed clinical psychologist, will now be published next week, two weeks earlier than expected, the publisher Simon & Schuster said Monday.

item.title: US Supreme Court says states can punish Electoral College voters
item.description: The Supreme Court said Monday that states can punish members of the Electoral College who fail to fulfill a pledge to vote for a state's popular vote winner in presidential elections.

item.title: Fox News cropped Trump out of photo with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, then called it a mistake
item.description: Fox News said on Monday that it "mistakenly" cropped President Trump out of a photograph that featured the accused sex-trafficker Jeffrey Epstein and his alleged accomplice Ghislaine Maxwell.

item.title: This glacier is turning pink, and that's bad news
item.description: A glacier in Italy is turning pink because of algae -- a development that will make the ice melt faster, a scientist studying the phenomenon says.

item.title: Elon Musk sells short shorts in jab at investors
item.description: Tesla is having a great year. Its stock is up 200% in 2020, its market value now exceeds every other carmaker on the planet, as well as Disney and Coke. CEO Elon Musk may truly have proved Tesla's haters wrong.

item.title: Ennio Morricone, Oscar-winning film composer, dies at 91
item.description: Ennio Morricone, the Oscar-winning film composer has died at the age of 91, his lawyer told CNN Monday.

item.title: Judge orders temporary shutdown of controversial Dakota Access Pipeline
item.description: The Dakota Access Pipeline must shut down by August 5 during an in-depth environmental review of the controversial project, a district court ruled Monday in a defeat for the Trump administration.

item.title: Everyday words and phrases that have racist connotations
item.description: The words and phrases permeate nearly every aspect of our society.

item.title: Facebook and WhatsApp won't give Hong Kong authorities user data for now
Video shows packed lake party in US despite warnings
item.description: Video from a water park in Wisconsin, and parties in Lake of the Ozarks, Missouri, and Diamond Lake, Michigan, shows large groups of people celebrating the Fourth of July holiday despite warnings from health officials that such gatherings would likely lead to an increase in coronavirus cases. CNN's Polo Sandoval reports.

item.title: 'Wear the damn mask,' Matthew McConaughey tells America
item.description: Matthew McConaughey got straight to the point in a new video posted on social media over the weekend.

item.title: Efforts to beat coronavirus pandemic could cause over 1 million extra deaths from other diseases, experts warn
item.description: As health services around the world continue to focus their resources on ending the coronavirus pandemic, they threaten to derail decades of hard-won progress in the response to HIV, TB and many other diseases. That's according to a new report by the International AIDS Society publishing this week.

item.title: Goldman Sachs thinks the US recovery is running into trouble
item.description: The surge in coronavirus cases across the Sun Belt is slowing the economic recovery in the United States.

item.title: This country is bucking Latin America's virus trend, here's how
item.description: Uruguay has been successfully managing its coronavirus outbreak, an outlier in a region that is being badly hit by the pandemic. CNN's Patrick Oppmann reports.

item.title: These senior Indian couples found love again. Not everyone is happy about it
item.description: Evening is Asawari Kulkarni's favorite time of the day. She spends it sipping green tea with her new partner Anil Yardi.

item.title: Iran now says mystery fire at nuclear facility resulted in 'significant' damage
item.description: A fire at Iran's Natanz nuclear facility site resulted in "significant" damage, impacting both the construction and development of the country's advanced nuclear program, officials confirmed Sunday, contradicting previous claims that the impact from last week's blaze had been "limited."

item.title: Protesters topple Christopher Columbus statue in Baltimore
item.description: While much of the country celebrated Independence Day, protesters in Baltimore toppled a statue of Christopher Columbus and threw it into the Inner Harbor, CNN affiliate WBAL reported.

item.title: What it's like to visit a country that doesn't exist
item.description: For various complicated reasons, a number of self-declared countries around the world aren't officially recognized -- some are even left off maps. Brazilian author Guilherme Canever has been to many of them and documented his adventures in a new book.

item.title: Here's a sign Warren Buffett may have gotten his mojo back
item.description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway finally put some cash to work with its purchase of natural gas assets from Dominion Energy. The deal could spark a broader turnaround for the Oracle of Omaha.

item.title: TikTok risks losing its biggest market
item.description: India is TikTok's top market for new downloads, and parent-company ByteDance had forecast $1 billion in advertising revenue there this year. Now India's ban on Chinese apps has put TikTok's fate in jeopardy in one of the fastest-growing markets in the world. CNN's Sherisse Pham reports.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan say the UK must reckon with its colonial past and 'right those wrongs'
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, have encouraged Britain to reckon with its colonial past, highlighting the "wrongs" of its historic involvement in the countries that now make up the Commonwealth.

item.title: Your security camera may be telling burglars when you're not home
item.description: Some popular home security cameras could allow would-be burglars to work out when you've left the building, according to a study published Monday.

item.title: Recently released giant tortoises settle back on their island
item.description: Fifteen recently released Espaola tortoises are settling back in their natural habitat after they spent decades in a breeding program to save their species from extinction.

item.title: Struggling airline swaps planes for trains
item.description: Austria's flagship airline is replacing one of its flights with a more frequent train service, in order to meet the environmental criteria of its recent government bailout.

item.title: Vogue Portugal drops widely slammed 'madness' cover depicting woman in a psychiatric hospital
item.description: Vogue Portugal has dropped one of the front covers of its July / August issue, after it was widely slammed online.

item.title: Mona Lisa is back but without the crowds as the Louvre reopens
item.description: The world's most popular museum, the Louvre, has reopened its doors after months of closure, but while visiting it will now be a slightly different experience, its star attraction should at least be free of crowds.

item.title: See police officer borrow bike to catch murder suspect
item.description: A biker in Atlanta helped police catch a murder suspect by loaning one of the officers his bike for the chase.

item.title: Dalai Lama marks his 85th birthday with his first ever album release
item.description: The 14th Dalai Lama is marking his 85th birthday by releasing his first ever album.

item.title: It's National Hot Dog month, so here's a history lesson on the American icon
item.description: From Germany to Coney Island, here's a history lesson on the hot dog, an American icon

item.title: How this budget airline could weather the pandemic storm
item.description: For more than two months, airport terminals in South Africa sat eerily silent. As the spread of coronavirus crippled demand for air travel across the globe, the country enacted one of the world's strictest lockdowns on March 27, effectively banning all commercial passenger flights.

item.title: Lionel Messi will finish his career at Barcelona, according to club president Josep Maria Bartomeu
item.description: Lionel Messi wants to stay with Barcelona until the end of his career, says club president Josep Maria Bartomeu, amid rumors the star is unsettled.

item.title: Children interrupt live BBC, Sky News interviews
item.description: Two live home interviews on BBC and Sky News in England had adorable interruptions on the same day.

item.title: Golfer wins event after heated exchange with cameraman
item.description: Powered by 40 pounds of additional muscle, Bryson DeChambeau claimed his sixth PGA Tour title at the Rocket Mortgage Classic in Detroit.

item.title: Australia to seal off 6.6 million people in virus-hit state
item.description: Australia will isolate 6.6 million people in the state of Victoria from the rest of the nation at 11.59 p.m. on Tuesday, as authorities take drastic action to control a coronavirus outbreak in the city of Melbourne.

item.title: NY governor: Trump 'is enabling the virus'
White House chief of staff repeats Trump's baseless claim
item.description: White House chief of staff Mark Meadows on Monday reiterated President Donald Trump's baseless claim that 99% of coronavirus cases are "totally harmless."

item.title: Africa's battle against Covid-19 will be won or lost here
item.description: Before the pandemic, when tourists flocked to Cape Town, they often ignored Khayelitsha township.

item.title: As Trump gaslights US about Covid-19, Republicans face a critical choice
item.description: Doctors say US in 'free fall' with Covid-19 CNN's Dana Bash presses senator: You criticized Obama for this in 2014

item.title: The myths fueling new Covid-19 surges
item.description: It's easy to fall into a false sense of security now that states have reopened. And many are already paying the price.

item.title: Oscar-winning film composer dies
item.description: Ennio Morricone, the Oscar-winning film composer, has died at the age of 91, his lawyer told CNN Monday.
